TESTO: A delicious, unexpected, series of surprises, and good value too Staying for a few days in Cagliari, we read through scores of Restaurant reviews, and it was very hard to choose.  We wanted a Sardinian supper but not an overpriced and under-skilled tourist version.  And we really didn't know how to choose.  Then I found that this small place, Dr Ampex, had very good reviews on TripAdvisor and other sites...so we booked.  Choosing wasn't difficult because there was no menu! On the other hand we managed perfectly well to communicate - mostly to say how delicious the previous course had been.  Orlando and his wife produced a seemingly endless variety of Antipasti, followed by pasta, and a main course, and a desert and a sticky drink - and with wine - all for 30 Euros inclusive.  This is a simple, friendly, and excellent trattoria, in a fine part of Cagliari, so we had a lovely walk back to our apartment in Marina district afterwards.  Highly recommended.  Thank you Orlando and Mrs Orlando.

We were given the menus and very lengthy menu seeking to cater for everything ( second mistake). We chose to start with Parma ham and burratta and salami with figs - both dishes were average. It seemed this place is busy and sits in the heart of a tourist area however after our numerous visits to Florence- we have never been disappointed in any of the restaurants - this is one definitely to avoid!!

TESTO: If one wants to taste real-real genoese food... Farinata S. Zita is a Genoese Specialty store, of tradition and, what is more, QUALITY, at very low price - as an estimator of good food, wherever (and a Genoese by birth), every time I am in Genoa I do my very best to eat there (a place for families, foodies, food lovers, gourmets (and... gourmands) - The eatery takes its name from the chickpeas flour (plus water and EVOO) - FARINATA - that happens to be one of the Genoese renowned local foods. It is excellent and oven cooked under the consumers' eyes - half a pound or less, plus a glass (or even two... they are "small glasses...) of Ligurian wine... and here you are. Then, another famous dish TORTA PASQUALINA (made with spinach & eggs); or BACCALA' ACCOMODATO; not to mention lightly fried freshly caught anchovies... literally "to die for" (can be eaten one after the other as one does with... cherries). The list can be long... one last recommendation: TROFIE, or any other pasta of the moment, with PESTO, the real Genoese Way, that is PESTO, with boiled French green beans and potatoes... unforgettable, especially when considering the cost - no surprise seeing there pensioners, students, tourists on a budget... enjoy!  Farinata one can take away easily and eat also if cold... And, do not forget the fabulous "Onions Focaccia"...(closed Sundays and Mondays, alas...).

TESTO: Surprisingly, disappointing We had lunch and making a reservation online was fairly easy. However, nearly completely disappointed, for the following reasons:
1. Portions: it is true that we shared each order as it was a late lunch and we had had a heavy breakfast, but the portions that we were served were ridiculous. We have dined at many Michelin starred restaurants and it can be a bit of a challenge with portions in these ‘designed food’ places, but nothing prepared us for the bite sized mains. The food itself and ingredients were fresh, but that doesn’t cover the fact.
2. Courtesy: As we were coming in, we were greeted by the chef (presumably, from the dress), as he was in the dining room with some patrons. He continued to drink with his patrons in his uniform, and later started serving them personally - going back and forth to the kitchen - to what appeared to be good portions, while our food was quite late in arriving, although the rest of the restaurant was empty. 
3. Interior: The horizontal aluminum louvres that wrap the space, cut off what is otherwise a nice view over the chic Milan neighborhood. The purpose and intent of this caged-in design was not understood, as it resulted in less than a nice feeling. 
The previous night we had dinner at the Bulgari Hotel, which was a much better experience food and service-wise and easily a better restaurant and ambiance.

Ci siamo accomodati al tavolo. Arrivano 3 tozzi di pane ed un coltello per poterlo affettare. Al mio coperto spiccava una forchetta che evidenziava i residui di un precedente pasto. Ottengo la sostituzione della forchetta mal pulita. Nessun menu cartaceo. Antipasti finiti. Ordiniamo i primi, che arrivano esattamente dopo 2 minuti. Difficilmente ho visto qualcosa di simile, forse nemmeno nelle mense nell’anno di militare: sono arrivati dei piatti che contenevano una pasta stracotta, bianca, ricoperta solo all’estremit√† del condimento. Arrivano anche i secondi: baccal√† della qualit√† peggiore qualit√†: 3 o 4 piccoli pezzi di carne attaccati a grandi ossa, dal gusto marcato di olio esausto. Arriva anche l’insalata, condita con un terribile oliaccio trasparente. Consumiamo velocemente e superficialmente. Paghiamo, ovviamente senza ricevere scontrino o ricevuta, e andiamo via interrogandoci con viva curiosit√† di come possa questo locale essere classificato 23esimo su oltre 2000 ristoranti.

TESTO: Highly Recommend We enjoyed our lunch at this restaurant very much.  There isn't a "menu" to look at, instead they just tell you the choices of the day.  It's a formula type menu where you can pick starter, primi or primi, secondo, etc.  Everything we ordered was really delicious and home-made.  It came out at different times, but we didn't mind because it was fresh and delicious and served in an informal atmosphere. We were surrounded by locals and what seemed to be friends of the restaurant owners.  

We ordered fagioli soup, pasta with ragu, meatballs with ragu, and antipasto of salami and cheese, including amazing local mozzerella.  It was served with bread, which was some of the best we ate while in Naples.  The house wine was also delicious.  Digestivo or meloncello was a bonus!!

The prices were very reasonable and a very good value.

We would recommend this place to anyone and when in Naples again, we plan to return!!

TESTO: Expensive, poor quality food with an unpleasant interior We ate a light lunch outside near the pool and had dinner that night inside. The lunch was expensive (43 euros) for a small hamburger, scoop of bad gelato, and iced tea. 

The dinner was more expensive (almost 200 euros) and had even more disappointing food. Although the wait staff was adequate, the taste and quality of the food did not match the outrageous prices. The food wasn't even close to the quality you would get at a random spot in Venice, but you don't have to take an hour round-trip to eat it. 

I am not averse to paying for convenience, so I would have grumbled about the food and the inflated prices, but left a 3-star review. What added insult to injury was the ambience of the interior of this restaurant. It honestly looks like a cheap cafeteria with incredibly bright, blaring lights that they said cannot be dimmed and cheap furniture that you would expect in an Ikea restaurant. 

Such a lovely hotel deserves an equivalent restaurant. This is sadly deeply deeply lacking.
